se.cbb.jprime.math

Class Gamma

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.cbb.jprime.math.Gamma

  • public class Gamma
extends java.lang.Object
    Not a gamma distribution per se; instead contains convenience methods concerning gamma functions. Returning logarithms is often necessary to avoid overflow. See also GammaDistribution.
    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand., Bengt Sennblad., Martin Linder.

    • Method Detail

      • lnGamma

        public static double lnGamma(double xx)
        Computes the natural logarithm of the complete gamma function, i.e., ln(Gamma(xx)) for xx > 0, where Gamma(x) = integral(t^(x-1) e^(-t), t=0,...,inf). Uses Lanczos' approximation formula, see Numerical Recipes 6.1. No bounds checking; see also lnGammaSafe(xx).

        This method is also known as loggamma_fn(xx).

        Parameters:
        xx - input parameter > 0.
        Returns:
        ln(Gamma(xx)) where Gamma(.) is the complete gamma function.

      • lnGammaSafe

        public static double lnGammaSafe(double xx)
        Identical to lnGamma(xx), but verifies that xx > 0 before computation.
        Parameters:
        xx - input parameter > 0.
        Returns:
        ln(Gamma(xx)) where Gamma(.) is the complete gamma function.

      • gammaQuantile

        public static double gammaQuantile(double p,
                   double k,
                   double theta)
        Quantile function for the gamma distribution, i.e. the inverse of the CDF function F. Note that notation of scale parameter theta is such that mean=k*theta. Sometimes rate parameter beta=1/theta is used instead.

        This method is also known as ppGamma(p, alpha=k, beta=1/theta).

        Parameters:
        p - probability.
        k - shape parameter.
        theta - scale parameter.
        Returns:
        x so that F(x)=P(X<=x)=p.

      • gammaCDF

        public static double gammaCDF(double x,
              double k,
              double theta)
        Computes the cumulative density function F(x) for a gamma distribution. Note that notation of scale parameter theta is such that mean=k*theta. Sometimes rate parameter beta=1/theta is used instead.
        Parameters:
        x - upper bound for region.
        k - shape parameter.
        theta - scale parameter
        Returns:
        F(x)=P(X<=x).

      • incGammaRatio

        public static double incGammaRatio(double x,
                   double k)
        Computes the incomplete gamma ratio function for positive values of arguments x and alpha. Uses series expansion if alpha > x or x < 1.0, otherwise a continued fraction expansion.

        Reference: Bhattacharjee, 1970, Algorithm AS 32, J.R.Stat.Soc.C. 19(3).

        This method is also known as gamma_in(x,alpha=k).

        Parameters:
        x - the value up to which to integrate.
        k - the gamma shape parameter.
        Returns:
        the incomplete gamma ratio function.

      • getDiscreteGammaCategories

        public static double[] getDiscreteGammaCategories(int n,
                                  double k,
                                  double theta)
        Discretises a continuous gamma distribution into n "categories", each holding an equal part of the probability mass, 1/n, then returns the mean value r_i for each category i. Note: The mean is returned, not the mean density!
        Parameters:
        n - number of discrete categories that the gamma distribution will be represented by.
        k - gamma distribution shape parameter.
        theta - gamma distribution scale parameter.
        Returns:
        the mean for each category.
